comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content:
I can't work out where this pic was taken...the lens distortion (which slightly stretches and flattens the landscape) also makes it difficult to recognise features such as hills.

Not sure we see the Godfrey & Sons Foundry in this pic...it's difficult to read the sign...from the few scraps of info I've been able to track down, I gather Godfrey & Sons made ornamental ironwork for buildings, etc...haven't yet been able to discover info re where their foundry was located.

The large building under construction looks like it might be a church...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks quasymody, it is certainly difficult to tell especially given all the buildings are submerged :S
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content:
Update (!)...I'm a bit of a slow donkey...it's only taken me 4 months to realise this pic fits together with the one next door...part of a wonderful panorama taken from North Quay...in this pic we're looking across the river to South Brisbane and West End towards Highgate Hill...

companion pic showing the view to the rhs
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/7252562882/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks QM - they come from the same strip of negatives (same object number) so that would make sense!
